conclusion: Analyze the circuit in two stages: switch closed and switch opened.
Capacitors C1 and C2 are in parallel; resistors R1 and R2 are in series when switch S is closed.
Voltage across each capacitor is 10V when switch is closed.
Charge stored on each capacitor when switch is closed is 300 μC.
Capacitors C1 and C2 are in series when switch S is opened.
Equivalent capacitance of capacitors in series is 15 μF.
Total charge remains 600 μC due to charge conservation.
Final charge on each capacitor is calculated to be 1200 μC.
Charge on each capacitor in series is 300 μC.
Charge passing through R1 is 0 μC.
Final answer: 0 μC passes through R1 after switch is opened.
